result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvin H Tatum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution has been paid in full from cash bond previously posted.

Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges granted. Report on or before April 1, 2016. Can be served in any county. Defendant is responsible for notifying Door County Jail if sentence is being served in different county.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin H Tatum

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: from DOC to Court re: DNA surcharge

Defendant Marvin H Tatum in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of offer from State that Defendant would like to accept. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to amended Count 1, Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect. Discussion regarding expungement. Court will not grant it at this time, mentions legislation that could affect status.

Defendant Marvin H Tatum in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received discovery and offer, client is working/living in Milwaukee, will be reviewing discovery today, requests status in early January, will have clearer picture of whether case will resolve or need trial scheduled.  Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Marvin H Tatum
Current: 3044 North 10th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States  (Effective: 11-30-2015)
Prior: 1343 Mccormick St, Green Bay, WI 54303
Defense places State's offer on the record, waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.

Defendant Marvin H Tatum in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Marvin H Tatum in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Set prelim.
No contact direct or indirect with The Nautical Inn or WC. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Marvin H Tatum appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 9/21/15, 10:00.
